src:
Keistimewaan Liverpool di Injury Time, Klopp Jeli Rotasi Pemain
03 Nov 2019, 07:05 by Terjemahan, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Keputusan Manajer Liverpool, Jurgen Klopp, memasukkan Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain dan Divock Origi pada 25 menit terakhir di Stadion Villa Park, Birmingham, Sabtu 2 November 2019, menjadi katalisator penentu kemenangan The Reds yang dramatis, yaitu 2-1, melawan Aston Villa.
Kemenangan itu menegaskan keistimewaan Liveverpool mengubah keadaan pada injury time, yakni tambahan waktu beberapa menit-menit setelah standar pertandingan normal dua babak selama 90 menit.
OptaJoe, informasi statistik tentang pertandingan sepak bola yang disediakan perusahaan penyedia data olahraga di dunia, Opta, mencatat gol penentu kemenangan Liverpool di Villa Park pada pekan ke-11 Liga Primer Inggris 2019-20 yang dicetak Sadio Mane ke-90+4 itu merupakan gol ke-35 kali yang dicetak pemain Liverpool dalam injury time.
Ketika gol yang dicepat pemain Villa asal Mesir, Mahmoud Hassan alias Trezeguet, pada menit ke-21, tidak kunjung bisa disamakan sampai memasuki menit ke-65 babak kedua, Jurgen Klopp kemudian menarik keluar penyerang Mohamed Salah, yang tampil di bawah bentuk permainan terbaiknya hari itu, dan juga gelandang Belanda, Georginio Wijnaldum.
Keduanya digantikan dua pemain muda, Oxlade-Chamberlain dan Origi. Pekan lalu adalah Origi yang menyelamatkan Liverpool dari ancaman kekalahan melawan Arsenal pada babak keempat Piala Carabao atau Piala Liga Inggris.
Saat melawan Arsenal pada Carabao Cup, Liverpool sudah ketinggalan 4-5 sampai pertandingan melewati waktu 90 menit. Dalam masa injury time, Origi asal Belgia inilah yang membobol gawang The Gunners dengan tendangan volinya.
Berkat aksi Origi, Liverpool bisa melanjutkan pertarungan melawan Arsenal dan kemudian menang adu penalti 5-4 untuk lolos ke babak perempat final Piala Liga Inggris.
Adapun Oxlade-Chamberlain melakukan aksi memuka pada pertandingan sebelumnya melawan Arsenal, yaitu pada pekan ke-3 Grup E Liga Champions 2019-20 di kandang Genk. Gelanda muda Inggris ini mencetak dua gol dalam kemenangan 4-0. Salah satunya berasal dari tendangan jarak jauh di luar kotak penalti.
Oxlade-Chamberlain dan Origi memang pada akhirnya tidak mencetak gol di Villa Park. Tapi, keduanya mengubah tekanan Liverpool ke daerah lawan menjadi lebih berbahaya.
Dalam gelombang tekanan yang mampu dilalukan secara intens, bek kiri Andy Robertson yang melalukan overlapping mampu menjebol gawang Villa pada menit ke-87 dengan sundulannya menyambut umpa Sadio Mane dan diikuti tandukan Mane menit 90+4 menyambar tendangan penjuru dari bek kanan Trent Alexander-Arnold.
Liverpool belum terkalahkan sampai pekan ke-11 Liga Primer Inggris musim ini , dengan 10 kali menang dan sekali seri. Di puncak klasemen, mereka unggul enam poin dari urutan kedua, juara bertahan Manchester City.
Setelah menjalani lanjutan fase grup Liga Champions pada Rabu dan Kamis dinihari mendatang, bakal terjadi big match dalam Liga Primer, Minggu, 10 November 2019, antara Liverpool dan Manchester City di Anfield.

BLEACHER REPORT | SOCCERNET
text:
The privilege of Liverpool at Injury Time, Klopp Jelly Players Rotation
03 Nov 2019, 07:05 by translations, Prasetyo Day
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Liverpool Manager Jurgen Klopp's decision to include Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain and Divock Origi in the last 25 minutes at the Villa Park Stadium, Birmingham, Saturday 2 November 2019, became the catalyst for the dramatic decisive victory of the Reds, which is 2-1 , against Aston Villa.
The victory confirms the privilege of Liveverpool changing the state of injury time, namely the extra time a few minutes after the standard normal two-round match for 90 minutes.
OptaJoe, statistical information about football matches provided by sports data providers in the world, Opta, recorded Liverpool's winning goal at Villa Park in the 11th week of the English Premier League 2019-20, which was printed by the 90th and 4th Sadio Mane. the 35 times scored by Liverpool players in injury time.
When a goal by Egyptian Villa player Mahmoud Hassan alias Trezeguet, in the 21st minute, could not be compared until it entered the 65th minute of the second half, Jurgen Klopp then pulled out the striker Mohamed Salah, who appeared under his best form of play for the day that, and also the Dutch midfielder, Georginio Wijnaldum.
Both were replaced by two young players, Oxlade-Chamberlain and Origi. Last week it was Origi who saved Liverpool from the threat of defeat against Arsenal in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup or the English League Cup.
When against Arsenal in the Carabao Cup, Liverpool were behind 4-5 until the match passed 90 minutes. In injury time, this Belgian Origi broke the Gunners' goal with his volley.
Thanks to Origi's action, Liverpool were able to continue the fight against Arsenal and then win 5-4 on penalties to qualify for the quarter-finals of the English League Cup.
The Oxlade-Chamberlain took the lead action in the previous match against Arsenal, namely in the third week of Group E Champions League 2019-20 at home to Genk. This young British midfielder scored two goals in a 4-0 win. One of them comes from a long distance kick outside the penalty box.
Oxlade-Chamberlain and Origi did not ultimately score at Villa Park. But, both of them turned Liverpool's pressure on the opposition into more dangerous areas.
In a wave of pressure that was able to be carried out intensely, left-back Andy Robertson who did overlapping was able to break Villa's goal in the 87th minute with his header welcoming Sadio Mane and followed by Mane's header 90 minutes +4 grabbed a corner kick from right-back Trent Alexander-Arnold.
Liverpool were unbeaten until Week 11 of the English Premier League this season, with 10 wins and one draw. At the top of the standings, they are six points ahead of second place, defending champion Manchester City.
After undergoing the Champions League group phase on Wednesday and Thursday in the early morning, there will be a big match in the Premier League, Sunday, November 10, 2019, between Liverpool and Manchester City at Anfield.

BLEACHER REPORT | SOCCERNET
